thread.title: Brit jihadi reveals hatred for his US Guantanamo captors | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Brit jihadi reveals hatred for his US Guantanamo captors | Daily Mail Online

author: Martin Robinson
title: Brit jihadi reveals hatred for his US Guantanamo captors | Daily Mail Online
text: 'I wanted to spit in their face': Brit jihadi who blew himself up in an ISIS suicide bomb reveals his hatred for his US captors in a rare interview just days after his release from Guantanamo Jamal al-Harith gave a rare interview days after he was released from Cuban jail US believed he was Al Qaeda fighter and ‘high threat' to them and other powers In 2004 he was released and Americans told him the believed he on MI5's books Describing his feeling on leaving Guantanamo he said: 'When they told me I was scared because I had been in a cage for so long I didn't want to leave' He wanted to sue the Americans but failed - but got up to £1m from the UK
